data.question: Who developed the method for polyhedral expansion?
What was the yield of the 14-vertex nido-carborane salt after recrystallization?
Is the 15-vertex ruthenacarborane more stable in air or in polar organic solvents?
data.answer: It is stable in air and soluble in polar organic solvents.

data.question: What is the role of the {(p-cymene)Ru} fragment in the synthesis of 15-vertex species?
data.answer: It is crucial for the formation of the 15-vertex species.

data.question: Can 5a be transformed into 5b under thermal conditions according to variable-temperature 11B NMR experiments?
data.answer: No, 5a cannot be transformed into 5b under these conditions.

data.question: Did the reaction of Na2-5a with [{(p-cymene)RuCl2}2] result in the formation of compound 4?
data.answer: No, compound 4 was not detected in the reaction.

data.question: Is the molecular structure of 3 confirmed by single-crystal X-ray diffraction?

Did the reaction of 3 with [{(p-cymene)RuCl2}2] in THF yield a 15-vertex ruthenacarborane in 62% yield?
What is the yield of 5a from the reaction of 13-vertex nido-carborane salt with [{(p-cymene)RuCl2}2]?
What is the geometry of 5a and 5b as revealed by single-crystal X-ray analyses?
What prevents the successful preparation of supercarboranes according to the text?
data.answer: Prevention of redox reactions is key to obtaining successively larger clusters.

data.question: Is the nido-metallacarborane dianion described as a very strong reductant?

What is the role of finely cut sodium metal in the synthesis of complex 3?
data.answer: It is added to a solution of 2 in THF and stirred at room temperature to give a clear yellow solution.
